entries.description: Gets or sets the list of ACLSpec entries on a file or directory.

group.description: Gets or sets the group owner, an AAD Object ID.

owner.name: owner
owner.description: Gets or sets the user owner, an AAD Object ID.

stickyBit.name: stickyBit
stickyBit.description: Gets or sets the indicator of whether the sticky bit is on or off.

AclStatusResult.description: Data Lake Store file or directory Access Control List information.

AclStatus.description: Gets or sets the AclStatus object for a given file or directory.

length.description: Gets the number of bytes used by the contet.

id.name: id
id.description: Gets the file unique identifier (as a GUID).

length.name: length
length.description: Gets the number of bytes in a file.

modificationTime.name: modificationTime
modificationTime.description: Gets the modification time as ticks since the epoch.

creationTime.name: creationTime
creationTime.description: Gets the creation time as ticks since the epoch.

expirationTime.name: expirationTime
expirationTime.description: Gets the expiration time, if any, as ticks since the epoch. If this is set to 0 or DateTime.MaxValue there is no expiration.

FileInfoResult.description: Data Lake Store filesystem file information response used with file expiration.

FileInfo.name: FileInfo
FileInfo.description: Gets the file information object associated with the specified file path.

FileOperationResult.description: The result of the request or operation.

boolean.name: boolean
boolean.description: Gets the result of the operation or request.

FileStatusProperties.name: FileStatusProperties

accessTime.name: accessTime
accessTime.description: Gets the last access time as ticks since the epoch.

blockSize.name: blockSize
blockSize.description: Gets the block size for the file.

childrenNum.name: childrenNum
childrenNum.description: Gets the number of children in the directory.

length.name: length
length.description: Gets the number of bytes in a file.

modificationTime.name: modificationTime
modificationTime.description: Gets the modification time as ticks since the epoch.

owner.name: owner
owner.description: Gets the user who is the owner.

permission.name: permission
permission.description: Gets the permission represented as an string.

type.name: type

title: DataLakeStoreFileSystemManagementClient
description: Creates an Azure Data Lake Store filesystem client.

op.name: op
op.description: The constant value for the operation.

subscriptionId.name: subscriptionId
subscriptionId.description: Gets subscription credentials which uniquely identify Microsoft Azure subscription. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every service call.

methods.description: Gets the file information object containing the expiration time for the file at the file path.

appendMode.name: appendMode
appendMode.description: Indicates the concurrent append call should create the file if it doesn't exist or just open the existing file for append

op.name: op
op.description: The constant value for the operation.

subscriptionId.name: subscriptionId
subscriptionId.description: Gets subscription credentials which uniquely identify Microsoft Azure subscription. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every service call.

application/octet-stream.name: application/octet-stream
application/octet-stream.description: A list of Data Lake Store paths (starting with '/') of the source files. Must be in the format: sources=<comma separated list>

methods.description: Appends to the specified file. This method supports multiple concurrent appends to the file. NOTE: Concurrent append and normal (serial) append CANNOT be used interchangeably. Once a file has been appended to using either append option, it can only be appended to using that append option.

expiryOption.name: expiryOption
expiryOption.description: Indicates the type of expiration to use for the file: 1. NeverExpire: ExpireTime is ignored. 2. RelativeToNow: ExpireTime is an integer in milliseconds representing the expiration date relative to when file expiration is updated. 3. RelativeToCreationDate: ExpireTime is an integer in milliseconds representing the expiration date relative to file creation. 4. Absolute: ExpireTime is an integer in milliseconds, as a Unix timestamp relative to 1/1/1970 00:00:00.

expireTime.name: expireTime
expireTime.description: The time that the file will expire, corresponding to the ExpiryOption that was set.

op.name: op
op.description: The constant value for the operation.

subscriptionId.name: subscriptionId
subscriptionId.description: Gets subscription credentials which uniquely identify Microsoft Azure subscription. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every service call.

methods.description: Sets or removes the expiration time on the specified file. This operation can only be executed against files. Folders are not supported.

filePath.name: filePath
filePath.description: The Data Lake Store path (starting with '/') of the file for which you want the file expiration information.

append.name: append

subscriptionId.name: subscriptionId
subscriptionId.description: Gets subscription credentials which uniquely identify Microsoft Azure subscription. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every service call.

application/octet-stream.name: application/octet-stream
application/octet-stream.description: A list of Data Lake Store paths (starting with '/') of the source files. Must be in the format: sources=<comma separated list>

methods.description: Appends to the specified file. This method does not support multiple concurrent appends to the file. NOTE: Concurrent append and normal (serial) append CANNOT be used interchangeably. Once a file has been appended to using either append option, it can only be appended to using that append option. Use the ConcurrentAppend option if you would like support for concurrent appends.

overwrite.description: The indication of if the file should be overwritten.

getFilePath.name: getFilePath
getFilePath.description: The Data Lake Store path (starting with '/') of the file or directory for which to retrieve the status.

listSize.name: listSize
listSize.description: Gets or sets the number of items to return. Optional.

listAfter.name: listAfter
listAfter.description: Gets or sets the item or lexographical index after which to begin returning results. For example, a file list of 'a','b','d' and listAfter='b' will return 'd', and a listAfter='c' will also return 'd'. Optional.

listBefore.name: listBefore
listBefore.description: Gets or sets the item or lexographical index before which to begin returning results. For example, a file list of 'a','b','d' and listBefore='d' will return 'a','b', and a listBefore='c' will also return 'a','b'. Optional.

listFilePath.description: The Data Lake Store path (starting with '/') of the directory to list.
